item.title: 法国出口民调显示议会悬而未决，欧元下跌
item.description: 法国议会选举最后一轮的出口民调显示，左翼新人民阵线（New Popular Front）将意外赢得最多席位，导致议会悬而未决，欧元在周日下跌。【原文：The euro fell on Sunday after exit polls for the final round of the French parliamentary elections pointed to a hung parliament, with the left wing New Popular Front grouping unexpectedly set to win the most seats.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，Revolut 首席执行官将以 5 亿美元出售部分股份
item.description: 据天空新闻周日报道，英国金融科技公司 Revolut 的首席执行官尼古拉-斯托伦斯基（Nikolay Storonsky）将把他持有的数十亿美元的公司股份部分套现，作为 5 亿美元股票出售的一部分。【原文：British fintech company Revolut's CEO Nikolay Storonsky will cash in part of his multibillion dollar stake in the company as part of a $500 million share sale, Sky News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 法国企业迎接政治动荡的新时代
item.description: 在周日的议会选举之前，在普罗旺斯举行会议的企业高管们表示，法国的商业精英们对动荡的政治、缺乏经验的决策者、街头抗议以及未来几个月可能出现的破产潮感到焦虑不安。【原文：France's business elite is anxious about volatile politics, inexperienced policymakers, street protests and a possible wave of bankruptcies in the coming months, executives meeting in Provence said ahead of Sunday's parliamentary election.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪收购泰国经销商 Rever Automotive 20% 的股份
item.description: 中国比亚迪和泰国Rever Automotive公司周六表示，比亚迪将收购泰国当地经销商Rever Automotive 20%的股份，泰国是比亚迪在中国以外的最大市场，比亚迪在泰国的电动汽车市场处于领先地位。【原文：China's BYD , will acquire a 20% stake in its local distributor Rever Automotive in Thailand, its largest market outside of China where it is an electric vehicle market leader, the companies said Saturday.】

item.title: 中国汽车集团对欧盟反补贴关税 "强烈不满
item.description: 中国汽车工业协会（CAAM）周六在一份声明中表示，该行业组织对欧盟提出的反补贴关税 "强烈不满"。【原文：The China Association of Automobile Manufacturers (CAAM) is "strongly dissatisfied" with anti-subsidy tariffs proposed by the European Union, the industry group said in a statement on Saturday.】

item.title: 轩尼诗所有者 LVMH 集团表示，对中国干邑的调查是对欧盟汽车关税的反应
item.description: 轩尼诗干邑所有者路威酩轩集团（LVMH）的财务总监周六表示，中国对欧洲干邑行业的反倾销调查是对欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税的针锋相对的反应。【原文：China's anti-dumping probe into Europe's cognac industry is a tit-for-tat reaction to European Union tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, the finance chief at Hennessy cognac owner LVMH said on Saturday.】

item.title: ASML 前首席执行官称中美芯片之争仍将继续
item.description: 这位刚刚退休的半导体设备制造商 ASML 首席执行官周六在接受荷兰 BNR 电台采访时说，中美在计算机芯片问题上的争端是意识形态上的，并非基于事实，而且这种争端还将继续下去。【原文：The recently retired CEO of semiconductor equipment maker ASML said in an interview with Dutch radio station BNR on Saturday that U.S.-China disputes over computer chips are ideological and not based on facts, and they are set to continue.】

item.title: Talen 要求美国监管机构驳回对亚马逊数据中心交易的质疑
item.description: 据周五提交的一份文件显示，Talen 能源公司已要求美国监管机构驳回对其最近与亚马逊数据中心达成的交易的质疑，该交易遭到了一些电力公司的反对，称该协议可能会提高普通民众的电费。【原文：Talen Energy has asked U.S. regulators to reject a challenge to its recent Amazon data center deal, which is being opposed by a group of electric utilities that say the agreement could raise power bills for the general public, according to a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 道明银行首席合规官在美国反洗钱调查中离职
item.description: 根据一份内部备忘录，道明银行的首席合规官已经离职，而这家加拿大贷款公司正面临美国监管机构和司法部对其反洗钱计划的调查。【原文：TD Bank's chief compliance officer has left the bank, according to a memo sent internally, at a time the Canadian lender faces U.S. regulators and the Justice Department in a probe related to its anti-money laundering program.】

item.title: 备忘录股炒作推动科斯股价周五上涨 25
item.description: 周五，耳机制造商科斯公司（Koss Corp. ）股价连续第二个交易日飙升，收于每股13.35美元，盘初曾一度冲高至18.50美元，原因是社交媒体上有帖子猜测，meme股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）的一篇帖子表明他对该公司感兴趣。【原文：Shares of headphone maker Koss Corp. soared for the second session in a row on Friday, closing at $13.35 a share, after trading as high as $18.50 early in the day, as social media posts speculated that a post by meme stock influencer Keith Gill indicated his interest in the company.】

item.title: 沃尔玛在美国联邦贸易委员会有关汇款欺诈的诉讼中胜诉
item.description: 美国一名法官驳回了联邦贸易委员会的一项核心诉讼请求，该诉讼指控沃尔玛对利用其汇款服务骗取消费者数亿美元的诈骗者视而不见。【原文：A U.S. judge threw out a central claim in a Federal Trade Commission lawsuit accusing Walmart of turning a blind eye to scam artists who used its money transfer services to fleece consumers out of hundreds of millions of dollars.】

item.title: 消息人士称凯雷正在洽谈收购百特的肾脏护理部门
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的人士周五告诉路透社，私募股权公司凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）正在进行独家谈判，准备以 40 多亿美元（包括债务）的价格收购百特国际（Baxter International）的肾脏护理分拆公司 Vantive。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle Group is in exclusive talks to acquire Baxter International's kidney care spinoff Vantive for more than $4 billion, including debt, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，支付处理商 NCR Voyix 探讨出售数字银行部门
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，支付处理商 NCR Voyix 正在探索出售其数字银行业务，希望能卖出高达 30 亿美元的价格。【原文：Payments processor NCR Voyix is exploring the sale of its digital banking business which it hopes will fetch as much as $3 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美国矿工推动华盛顿重振沉寂已久的矿业局
item.description: 矿业贸易团体计划推动华盛顿重振并扩大沉寂已久的矿业局，这一努力旨在简化美国政府监管和支持重要矿产生产的方式，时间上也与 2024 年总统大选相吻合。【原文：Mining trade groups plan to push Washington to revive and expand the long-dormant Bureau of Mines, an effort aimed at streamlining how the U.S. government regulates and supports critical minerals production and timed to coincide with the 2024 presidential election.】

item.title: 美国通胀放缓，就业市场与疫情爆发前相似--美联储报告
item.description: 美联储周五在一份国会报告中称，通胀正在缓解，就业市场已恢复到 COVID-19 大流行病使美国经济陷入混乱之前的 "紧张但不过热 "的状态，该报告记录了健康危机后美国经济稳步恢复正常的情况。【原文：Inflation is easing and the job market has returned to the "tight but not overheated" situation seen before the COVID-19 pandemic threw the U.S. economy into disarray, the Federal Reserve said on Friday in a congressional report that documented the steady emergence of more normal conditions in the aftermath of the health crisis.】

item.title: 瑞士央行行长乔丹将银行崩盘归咎于瑞士信贷的老板们
item.description: 周五，瑞士国家银行主席托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）被引述说，瑞士信贷银行的倒闭是该银行管理层造成的，而不是瑞士金融当局造成的。【原文：Credit Suisse's collapse was caused by the bank's management, not by Swiss financial authorities, Swiss National Bank Chairman Thomas Jordan was quoted as saying on Friday.】

item.title: 马斯克暗示延迟披露推特信息是个错误，并寻求结束诉讼
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）希望驳回推特（Twitter）前股东提出的诉讼，这些股东称他在 2022 年初披露其在这家社交媒体公司的巨额股权时等得太久，并称 "所有迹象 "都表明他的延迟是个错误。【原文：Elon Musk wants to dismiss a lawsuit by former Twitter shareholders who said he waited too long in early 2022 to reveal his large ownership stake in the social media company, saying "all indications" show his delay was a mistake.】

item.title: 美国就业市场降温，美联储降息辩论引人关注
item.description: 一份显示美国劳动力市场继续降温的政府报告可能会给美联储的政策制定者们增添信心，他们正在赢得与通胀的斗争，从而引发他们在下一次会议上就降息问题进行更积极的讨论。 美国劳工部的月度报告显示，6 月份的失业率上升至 4.1%，而对上月预估值的大幅修正意味着平均每月失业率为 4.1%。【原文：A government report showing the U.S. labor market continues to cool could give Federal Reserve policymakers added confidence they are winning their fight on inflation, sparking a more active debate on interest-rate cuts at their next meeting. The Labor Department's monthly report showed the unemployment rate rose in June to 4.1%, and big revisions to prior-month estimates meant the average monthly】

item.title: 诺和诺德因未披露向医疗保健行业支付的款项而在英国受到斥责
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德公司因未披露 2020 年至 2022 年间向英国个人和组织支付的约 780 万英镑（997 万美元）的费用和开支而受到英国监管机构的谴责。【原文：Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk has been reprimanded by UK regulators for failing to disclose fees and expenses paid to individuals and organisations in Britain amounting to about 7.8 million pounds ($9.97 million) between 2020 and 2022.】

item.title: 研究人员称，上半年加密货币黑客盗窃案翻了一番，达到 14 亿美元
item.description: 区块链研究机构 TRM Labs 周五表示，2024 年前六个月，全球因黑客攻击而被盗的加密货币数量比去年同期增加了一倍多，主要原因是少数大型攻击和加密货币价格上涨。【原文：The amount of cryptocurrency stolen in hacks globally more than doubled in the first six months of 2024 from a year earlier, driven by a small number of large attacks and rising crypto prices, blockchain researchers TRM Labs said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月就业增长放缓，失业率上升
item.description: 故事：6 月份，美国就业增长放缓，失业率升至 4.1%，仍处于健康水平，这增加了美联储在不使经济陷入衰退的情况下抑制通货膨胀的可能性。【原文：STORY: U.S. job growth slowed to a still-healthy pace in June, with the unemployment rate rising to 4.1%, increasing the chances that the Federal Reserve will be able to tame inflation without tipping the economy into recession.】

item.title: 美国股票基金因降息预期而需求旺盛
item.description: 截至7月3日的一周内，投资者囤积了大量美国股票基金，因为数据显示经济疲软以及美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的鸽派评论巩固了降息预期。【原文：Investors hoovered up U.S. equity funds in the week to July 3 as data indicating a softening economy and U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's dovish commentary solidified rate cut expectations.】

item.title: 欧洲顶级干邑制造商将出席中国反倾销调查会议 - 消息人士
item.description: 一位业内人士称，欧洲主要干邑生产商将于 7 月 18 日在北京出席中国对该行业进行反倾销调查的听证会，这是自今年早些时候调查开始以来他们首次有机会亲自为自己辩护。【原文：Leading European cognac producers will attend a hearing on China's anti-dumping probe of the industry in Beijing on July 18 - their first chance to defend themselves in person since the investigation began earlier this year, an industry source said.】

item.title: Epic Games 称苹果公司拖延在欧洲推出游戏商店
item.description: "堡垒之夜》制造商 Epic Games 周五表示，苹果公司正在阻碍其在欧洲的 iPhone 和 iPad 上建立游戏商店的尝试，这是科技巨头控制 iOS 应用生态系统的激烈争斗的最新升级。【原文："Fortnite" maker Epic Games said on Friday Apple was impeding its attempts to set up a games store on iPhones and iPads in Europe, the latest escalation in a bitter feud over the technology giant's control of the iOS app ecosystem.】

item.title: 降息预期升温，全球股票基金连续两周吸引资金流入
item.description: 截至7月3日的一周内，全球投资者纷纷投入股票基金，原因是在经济指标疲软和美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔发表鸽派言论后，市场预期美国将降息。【原文：Global investors piled into equity funds in the week to July 3 on expectations of U.S. rate cuts following weaker economic indicators and dovish remarks from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 欧盟称威士卡和万事达卡将把非欧盟卡收费上限延长至 2029 年
item.description: 欧盟委员会周五表示，威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）将把五年前与欧盟反垄断监管机构达成的旅游卡收费上限再延长五年，至 2029 年。【原文：Visa and Mastercard will extend caps on tourist card fees agreed five years ago with EU antitrust regulators by another five years to 2029, the European Commission said on Friday.】

item.title: 国泰航空回购香港政府剩余的 50%优先股
item.description: 香港国泰航空公司周五表示，将回购 7 月 31 日发行给香港特区政府的剩余 50% 优先股。【原文：Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways will buy back the remaining 50% of preference shares that were issued to the Hong Kong SAR Government on July 31, the company said on Friday.】

item.title: 中国监管机构誓言严厉打击资本市场欺诈行为
item.description: 中国证券监管机构周五誓言将加大对金融欺诈的打击力度，并表示正在推动对违法者实施更严厉的惩罚，以重振人们对中国陷入困境的股市的信心。【原文：China's securities regulator vowed on Friday to clamp down harder on financial fraud, saying it is pushing for harsher punishment against lawbreakers as it seeks to revive confidence in the country's struggling stock markets.】

item.title: 汽车制造商回应欧盟对中国产电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 随着欧盟对中国生产的电动汽车（EV）征收额外关税的措施于周五生效，一些汽车制造商一直在考虑是否提高价格或采取其他应对措施。【原文：With the European Union's extra duties on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs) taking effect on Friday, some carmakers have been considering whether to raise their prices or take other measures in response.】

item.title: 欧盟要求亚马逊提供更多有关数字服务法案合规性的信息
item.description: 欧盟委员会周五表示，已要求亚马逊提供更多信息，说明这家美国电子商务巨头为履行《数字服务法案》（DSA）义务所采取的措施。【原文：The European Commission said on Friday it had requesting Amazon provide more information on the measures the U.S. e-commerce giant has taken to comply with its Digital Services Act (DSA) obligations.】
